service_description: Dedicated to preserving and advancing civil liberties and civil rights. Assistance in cases that will establish precedent on civil liberties and civil rights principles.
Immigration legal services. Spanish speakers available. Call for appt.
Support for people who have suffered physical, emotional, and/or financial harm as a result of the commission of a crime. Assistance filing restraining orders for stalking and sexual assault.
hours: Crisis line hours: 24/7. Office hours: 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Mon.-Fri.

service_description: Information, referral and advocacy for civil rights of people with disabilities, including employment, special education, rights to public and private services, guardianship, voting, and in-care facilities or institutions.

listing: Know Your Rights City of Portland Independent Police Review
Know Your Rights Multnomah County District Attorney
Know Your Rights Multnomah County District Attorney

service_description: For police complaints in Portland only.
Referrals to attorneys in the area of needed assistance; a 30 minute consultation is $35 and other lower cost options available as well.
Free legal assistance in civil cases for low-income residents of Clack., Mult., Hood River, Sherman and Wasco counties. Call for consultation.
hours:
Hours: 9 a.m.-12p.m. & 1-4 p.m. Mon.-Thurs. 
9 a.m.-12p.m., 1p.m.-3 p.m. Fri.

service_description: No appointments necessary.  Walk-ins and phone contact accepted. Part of the Oregon Law Center. Provides free legal assistance to low-income farmworkers. Typically help with cases related to employment as a farmerworker including wage claims, discrimination, sexual harassment, claims under laws that apply to farm labor contractors and agricultural employers, housing and occupational health and safety.
hours:
Hours: 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Mon.-Thurs.
Other hours by appt.

service_description: Family Law hotline: 503-676-5400; Public Benefits hotline 1-800-520-5292. Assistance with civil legal services. No criminal or personal injury cases. Please call the main line for eviction defense.
hours:
Phone hours 9 a.m. -12 a.m. and 1p.m.-4 p.m Mon.-Fri. 
Walk-in hours: Tues. and Thurs. 1-4 p.m.

service_description:
All property collected by the City of Portland is maintained by Rapid Response Bio Clean, at their storage facility, for a minimum of 30 days after the day it was collected.
Call Rapid Response Bio Clean to locate your property. 503-387-1336. Please be ready to provide a date and location from which the property was taken. Property left for longer than 30 days from the date it was taken will be destroyed and/or donated.
hours:
Hours: 9:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Mon.-Fri.
10:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Sat.

service_description: Provides legal services in the area of family law to low-income individuals and families in Mult. and Clack. counties. Charges based on a sliding scale. $40 for a 30-minute consultation. Call or go to www.salcgroup.org to request an appointment.

Community-based nonprofit organization that provides legal services in the area of family law to low-income individuals and families in Washington, Yamhill and Columbia counties. Charges based on sliding scale, $50 for consultations via phone only.  You must call for an appointment.
hours:
Hours: 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Mon.-Fri. 
Closed noon-1 p.m.

service_description: Social Security disability, personal injury and workers compensation legal services for injured and disabled people. Spanish-speaking attorney. Free phone consultation.

Free and confidential legal advice and representation for victims of sexual assault, rape, and unconsensual sexual touching of an intimate body part. Plus legal advice and representation for education, immigration, housing, employment, privacy, and safety matters  in Multnomah, Clackamas and Washington counties. Limited statewide services.
hours: Hours: 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Mon.-Fri. Call for appt.
